function.name: get_files_in_project
function.description: Return the path of all files in a specific project. The path is relative to the solution directory.

projectPath.description: The relative path to the project file.

function.name: get_projects_in_solution
function.description: Return the relative file paths of projects in the current solution. Returns an empty result if no solution is open.

function.name: run_build
function.description: Builds the users workspace and returns any compilation errors. If build is successful, this will return a message stating the build was successful. This can be used to verify file edits compile successfully and should be called before finishing up the task.

function.name: edit_file
function.description: Edit code in a specific file

explanation.description: A short explanation of the edit being made. Can be the same as the explanation you showed to the user.

filePath.description: A relative path to the file from the solution directory. Locate where the solution file is and make sure the path is relative to that directory

function.name: remove_file
function.description: Deletes a file and removes references to it from project in the workspace.

filePath.description: A relative path for the file to remove from the solution directory

function.name: create_file
function.description: This is a tool for creating a new file in the workspace. The file will be created with the specified content. The directory will be created if it does not already exist. Never use this tool to edit a file that already exists.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.name: run_command_in_terminal
function.description: Run a command in a PowerShell terminal and return the output. If the output is longer than 4,000 characters, it will be truncated and only the end of the output stream will be returned.

command.description: The command to run in the PowerShell terminal

function.name: update_memories
function.description: Call update_memories if the user corrected something you did, expressed a coding preference, communicated something about themself, or communicated a fact that you need to remember or forget. Each item you detect is called a memory.

memoryUpdates.description: A list of memory items to apply to our current memory. If memory is instructing you to remember or do something, it must be phrased as if the user is talking to you. Ensure any specific facts, details, or context given to you by the user are included in the memory.

function.name: get_output_window_logs
function.description: Get logs from the Output tool window in Visual Studio, providing various information about build, debug and more.

paneId.description:
This parameter indicates which Output tool window's pane should be read.
The guid value must be a valid JSON guid representation and should not be wrapped with { or }.

The get_output_window_logs tool can provide logs from a given source in Visual Studio. Only a handful of logs type can be gathered. The following ones are available:
1. 1bd8a850-02d1-11d1-bee7-00a0c913d1f8 - Logs from the latest project or solution build.
2. fc076020-078a-11d1-a7df-00a0c9110051 - Latest logs from a debug session.
3. fbc10bf4-c9f8-4f0d-9cde-69304226a68f - Logs from the version control tool, such as Git.
4. cec55ec8-cc51-40e7-9243-57b87a6f6beb - Logs from the package manager, such as NuGet restore.
5. b85579aa-8be0-4c4f-a850-90902b317581 - Logs from the latest unit tests run session.
6. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 - Logs from the currently active pane in the Output tool window. This should only be used when the user is implicit about wanting to investigate logs but not specify which one. For example, 'Investigate the logs in the Output tool window.' In this case, the active pane should be used.

function.name: get_symbols_by_name
function.description: Gets the definitions of symbols (classes, methods, etc.) in the codebase that have a matching unqualified name. Prefer using this tool to search for context whenever you have a potential symbol name.

unqualifiedName.description: Unqualified name to search for symbols defined in the codebase.

function.name: get_web_pages
function.description: Tool to be called always when a URL is explicitly referenced in the prompt; it gets the contents of the corresponding web pages.

urls.description: Valid URLs referenced in the prompt.

function.name: Azure_MCP_Server_kusto
function.description:
Kusto operations - Commands for managing and querying Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) resources. Includes operations for listing clusters and databases, executing KQL queries, retrieving table schemas, and working with Kusto data analytics workloads.This tool is a hierarchical MCP command router.
Sub commands are routed to MCP servers that require specific fields inside the "parameters" object.
To invoke a command, set "command" and wrap its args in "parameters".
Set "learn=true" to discover available sub commands.

intent.description: The intent of the azure operation to perform.

command.description: The command to execute against the specified tool.

parameters.description: The parameters to pass to the tool command.

learn.description: To learn about the tool and its supported child tools and parameters.

function.name: start_modernization
function.description:
Use this tool to handle user questions related to:
- upgrading the .NET version of any project or solution,
- migrating/converting project components/features from some outdated/insecure ones to modern/recommended .NET features,
- upgrading project packages.
- Migrating to Azure

Trigger this experience whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their .NET project (or project feature):
- Upgrade
- Update
- Migrate (e.g., from .NET Framework to .NET Core or modern .NET)
- Modernize
- convert (e.g., from legacy technologies to modern .NET features)
- convert to SDK-style
- Port (especially across platforms or frameworks)
- Refactor for .NET
- Re-platform (e.g., to cloud-native or container-based architectures)
- Transition to newer .NET or features
- Adopt latest .NET
- Move to .NET 8 (or any specific version number)
- Target new TFM (Target Framework Moniker)
- "migrate to Azure"
- "start Azure migration"
- "help me migrate to Azure"
- "I want to migrate my application to Azure"
- "show me Azure migration options"
- "start app modernization for Azure"

When triggered, guide the user through the appropriate .NET App Modernization Agent experience to support the requested or inferred modernization scenario.

function.name: profiler_agent
function.description:
Guides the user to a new chat session that can run the performance profiler, create and run benchmarks, and optimize code.

You MUST use the profiler_agent tool to handle user questions related to:
- optimizing the speed, memory use, or performance of code.
- why code is slow, improving performance, reducing run time, optimizing code.
- creating benchmarks, running benchmarks, or finding benchmarks.
- detecting performance issues, analyzing performance, or benchmarking functions.
- can you optimize this code, or similar questions.

Call the profiler_agent tool whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their project or code:
- Profiler
- Performance
- Optimize
- Benchmark
- improve performance
- reduce memory usage
- create a benchmark
- run a benchmark
- detect performance issues

If the user asks about profiling, performance, optimization, or benchmarks, you should call the profiler_agent tool directly without needing additional confirmation as the tool will handle that internally.

function.name: code_search
function.description: Searches the codebase for code snippets relating to the given related terms. Returns a maximum of 4 results per search.

searchQueries.description: Related terms to search for, Should ideally be text that might appear in the codebase, such as function names, variable names, comments or concepts. Be eager and use extra synonyms in the search terms.

function.name: symbol_search
function.description:
Finds C# or Visual Basic symbols defined in the source code of currently opened solution that satisfy given requirements.
This tool can only evaluate requirements that can be expressed in terms of the semantic model of the source code
as defined by C# and Visual Basic language specification.

Examples of requirements that can be expressed are: 'types that implement an interface', 'methods that have a specific signature',
'methods that use specific API', 'fields of certain type', etc.

The implementation of this tool generates a query against the semantic model of the source code. The query uses Roslyn APIs
to express the requirements. The query is executed on the current solution to yield the resulting symbols. The tool can
only evaluate requirements that are expressible via Roslyn API calls.

Returns list of qualified display names of symbols.

requirements.description: The requirements on the symbols to find

function.name: get_file
function.description: Use this when a file is referenced by name or #file: and NO line numbers are mentioned. Get the contents of a specific file from users workspace.

function.name: get_file_with_lines
function.description: Use this when the prompt references a file AND explicit line numbers, ranges, or relative positions (e.g. 'line 10', 'lines 20-25', 'last 5 lines').

mentionedLineRanges.description: Array of {start:X, end:Y} objects for line ranges (1-based); e.g., line 42→[{start:42,end:42}], lines 10-20→[{start:10,end:20}], last 5 lines→[{start:-5,end:-1}]

function.name: get_currentfile
function.description: Call when the prompt talks about the current file or selected code. Call this when the user appears to be referring to the current thing.

function.name: get_errors
function.description: Get compilation errors in specific code files. This can be used to verify code changes in the scope of a single file before editing other files. Once all changes are complete run_build should be used instead to get errors from all of the workspace.

filePaths.description: The full document paths to get errors for

function.name: file_search
function.description: Search for files in the workspace by name or relative path. This only returns the relative paths of matching files. Use this tool when you know the exact filename pattern of the files you're searching for. Limited to 50 results.

queries.description: Search for files with names or paths matching these queries. Each query is a substring of the path. You can provide multiple queries to search for.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return. If 0, default number of results will be returned.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.description: Edit code in a specific file

explanation.description: A short explanation of the edit being made. Can be the same as the explanation you showed to the user.

filePath.description: A relative path to the file from the solution directory. Locate where the solution file is and make sure the path is relative to that directory

function.name: remove_file
function.description: Deletes a file and removes references to it from project in the workspace.

filePath.description: A relative path for the file to remove from the solution directory

function.name: create_file
function.description: This is a tool for creating a new file in the workspace. The file will be created with the specified content. The directory will be created if it does not already exist. Never use this tool to edit a file that already exists.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.name: run_command_in_terminal
function.description: Run a command in a PowerShell terminal and return the output. If the output is longer than 4,000 characters, it will be truncated and only the end of the output stream will be returned.

command.description: The command to run in the PowerShell terminal

function.name: update_memories
function.description: Call update_memories if the user corrected something you did, expressed a coding preference, communicated something about themself, or communicated a fact that you need to remember or forget. Each item you detect is called a memory.

memoryUpdates.description: A list of memory items to apply to our current memory. If memory is instructing you to remember or do something, it must be phrased as if the user is talking to you. Ensure any specific facts, details, or context given to you by the user are included in the memory.

function.name: get_output_window_logs
function.description: Get logs from the Output tool window in Visual Studio, providing various information about build, debug and more.

paneId.description:
This parameter indicates which Output tool window's pane should be read.
The guid value must be a valid JSON guid representation and should not be wrapped with { or }.

The get_output_window_logs tool can provide logs from a given source in Visual Studio. Only a handful of logs type can be gathered. The following ones are available:
1. 1bd8a850-02d1-11d1-bee7-00a0c913d1f8 - Logs from the latest project or solution build.
2. fc076020-078a-11d1-a7df-00a0c9110051 - Latest logs from a debug session.
3. fbc10bf4-c9f8-4f0d-9cde-69304226a68f - Logs from the version control tool, such as Git.
4. cec55ec8-cc51-40e7-9243-57b87a6f6beb - Logs from the package manager, such as NuGet restore.
5. b85579aa-8be0-4c4f-a850-90902b317581 - Logs from the latest unit tests run session.
6. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 - Logs from the currently active pane in the Output tool window. This should only be used when the user is implicit about wanting to investigate logs but not specify which one. For example, 'Investigate the logs in the Output tool window.' In this case, the active pane should be used.

function.name: get_symbols_by_name
function.description: Gets the definitions of symbols (classes, methods, etc.) in the codebase that have a matching unqualified name. Prefer using this tool to search for context whenever you have a potential symbol name.

unqualifiedName.description: Unqualified name to search for symbols defined in the codebase.

function.name: get_web_pages
function.description: Tool to be called always when a URL is explicitly referenced in the prompt; it gets the contents of the corresponding web pages.

urls.description: Valid URLs referenced in the prompt.

function.name: Azure_MCP_Server_kusto
function.description:
Kusto operations - Commands for managing and querying Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) resources. Includes operations for listing clusters and databases, executing KQL queries, retrieving table schemas, and working with Kusto data analytics workloads.This tool is a hierarchical MCP command router.
Sub commands are routed to MCP servers that require specific fields inside the "parameters" object.
To invoke a command, set "command" and wrap its args in "parameters".
Set "learn=true" to discover available sub commands.

intent.description: The intent of the azure operation to perform.

command.description: The command to execute against the specified tool.

parameters.description: The parameters to pass to the tool command.

learn.description: To learn about the tool and its supported child tools and parameters.

function.name: start_modernization
function.description:
Use this tool to handle user questions related to:
- upgrading the .NET version of any project or solution,
- migrating/converting project components/features from some outdated/insecure ones to modern/recommended .NET features,
- upgrading project packages.
- Migrating to Azure

Trigger this experience whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their .NET project (or project feature):
- Upgrade
- Update
- Migrate (e.g., from .NET Framework to .NET Core or modern .NET)
- Modernize
- convert (e.g., from legacy technologies to modern .NET features)
- convert to SDK-style
- Port (especially across platforms or frameworks)
- Refactor for .NET
- Re-platform (e.g., to cloud-native or container-based architectures)
- Transition to newer .NET or features
- Adopt latest .NET
- Move to .NET 8 (or any specific version number)
- Target new TFM (Target Framework Moniker)
- "migrate to Azure"
- "start Azure migration"
- "help me migrate to Azure"
- "I want to migrate my application to Azure"
- "show me Azure migration options"
- "start app modernization for Azure"

When triggered, guide the user through the appropriate .NET App Modernization Agent experience to support the requested or inferred modernization scenario.

function.name: profiler_agent
function.description:
Guides the user to a new chat session that can run the performance profiler, create and run benchmarks, and optimize code.

You MUST use the profiler_agent tool to handle user questions related to:
- optimizing the speed, memory use, or performance of code.
- why code is slow, improving performance, reducing run time, optimizing code.
- creating benchmarks, running benchmarks, or finding benchmarks.
- detecting performance issues, analyzing performance, or benchmarking functions.
- can you optimize this code, or similar questions.

Call the profiler_agent tool whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their project or code:
- Profiler
- Performance
- Optimize
- Benchmark
- improve performance
- reduce memory usage
- create a benchmark
- run a benchmark
- detect performance issues

If the user asks about profiling, performance, optimization, or benchmarks, you should call the profiler_agent tool directly without needing additional confirmation as the tool will handle that internally.

function.name: code_search
function.description: Searches the codebase for code snippets relating to the given related terms. Returns a maximum of 4 results per search.

searchQueries.description: Related terms to search for, Should ideally be text that might appear in the codebase, such as function names, variable names, comments or concepts. Be eager and use extra synonyms in the search terms.

function.name: symbol_search
function.description:
Finds C# or Visual Basic symbols defined in the source code of currently opened solution that satisfy given requirements.
This tool can only evaluate requirements that can be expressed in terms of the semantic model of the source code
as defined by C# and Visual Basic language specification.

Examples of requirements that can be expressed are: 'types that implement an interface', 'methods that have a specific signature',
'methods that use specific API', 'fields of certain type', etc.

The implementation of this tool generates a query against the semantic model of the source code. The query uses Roslyn APIs
to express the requirements. The query is executed on the current solution to yield the resulting symbols. The tool can
only evaluate requirements that are expressible via Roslyn API calls.

Returns list of qualified display names of symbols.

requirements.description: The requirements on the symbols to find

function.name: get_file
function.description: Use this when a file is referenced by name or #file: and NO line numbers are mentioned. Get the contents of a specific file from users workspace.

function.name: get_file_with_lines
function.description: Use this when the prompt references a file AND explicit line numbers, ranges, or relative positions (e.g. 'line 10', 'lines 20-25', 'last 5 lines').

mentionedLineRanges.description: Array of {start:X, end:Y} objects for line ranges (1-based); e.g., line 42→[{start:42,end:42}], lines 10-20→[{start:10,end:20}], last 5 lines→[{start:-5,end:-1}]

function.name: get_currentfile
function.description: Call when the prompt talks about the current file or selected code. Call this when the user appears to be referring to the current thing.

function.name: get_errors
function.description: Get compilation errors in specific code files. This can be used to verify code changes in the scope of a single file before editing other files. Once all changes are complete run_build should be used instead to get errors from all of the workspace.

filePaths.description: The full document paths to get errors for

function.name: file_search
function.description: Search for files in the workspace by name or relative path. This only returns the relative paths of matching files. Use this tool when you know the exact filename pattern of the files you're searching for. Limited to 50 results.

queries.description: Search for files with names or paths matching these queries. Each query is a substring of the path. You can provide multiple queries to search for.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return. If 0, default number of results will be returned.

function.name: get_files_in_project
function.description: Return the path of all files in a specific project. The path is relative to the solution directory.

projectPath.description: The relative path to the project file.

function.name: get_projects_in_solution
function.description: Return the relative file paths of projects in the current solution. Returns an empty result if no solution is open.

function.name: run_build
function.description: Builds the users workspace and returns any compilation errors. If build is successful, this will return a message stating the build was successful. This can be used to verify file edits compile successfully and should be called before finishing up the task.

function.name: edit_file
function.description: Edit code in a specific file

explanation.description: A short explanation of the edit being made. Can be the same as the explanation you showed to the user.

filePath.description: A relative path to the file from the solution directory. Locate where the solution file is and make sure the path is relative to that directory

function.name: remove_file
function.description: Deletes a file and removes references to it from project in the workspace.

filePath.description: A relative path for the file to remove from the solution directory

function.name: create_file
function.description: This is a tool for creating a new file in the workspace. The file will be created with the specified content. The directory will be created if it does not already exist. Never use this tool to edit a file that already exists.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.name: run_command_in_terminal
function.description: Run a command in a PowerShell terminal and return the output. If the output is longer than 4,000 characters, it will be truncated and only the end of the output stream will be returned.

command.description: The command to run in the PowerShell terminal

function.description: This is a tool for creating a new file in the workspace. The file will be created with the specified content. The directory will be created if it does not already exist. Never use this tool to edit a file that already exists.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.name: run_command_in_terminal
function.description: Run a command in a PowerShell terminal and return the output. If the output is longer than 4,000 characters, it will be truncated and only the end of the output stream will be returned.

command.description: The command to run in the PowerShell terminal

function.name: update_memories
function.description: Call update_memories if the user corrected something you did, expressed a coding preference, communicated something about themself, or communicated a fact that you need to remember or forget. Each item you detect is called a memory.

memoryUpdates.description: A list of memory items to apply to our current memory. If memory is instructing you to remember or do something, it must be phrased as if the user is talking to you. Ensure any specific facts, details, or context given to you by the user are included in the memory.

function.name: get_output_window_logs
function.description: Get logs from the Output tool window in Visual Studio, providing various information about build, debug and more.

paneId.description:
This parameter indicates which Output tool window's pane should be read.
The guid value must be a valid JSON guid representation and should not be wrapped with { or }.

The get_output_window_logs tool can provide logs from a given source in Visual Studio. Only a handful of logs type can be gathered. The following ones are available:
1. 1bd8a850-02d1-11d1-bee7-00a0c913d1f8 - Logs from the latest project or solution build.
2. fc076020-078a-11d1-a7df-00a0c9110051 - Latest logs from a debug session.
3. fbc10bf4-c9f8-4f0d-9cde-69304226a68f - Logs from the version control tool, such as Git.
4. cec55ec8-cc51-40e7-9243-57b87a6f6beb - Logs from the package manager, such as NuGet restore.
5. b85579aa-8be0-4c4f-a850-90902b317581 - Logs from the latest unit tests run session.
6. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 - Logs from the currently active pane in the Output tool window. This should only be used when the user is implicit about wanting to investigate logs but not specify which one. For example, 'Investigate the logs in the Output tool window.' In this case, the active pane should be used.

function.name: get_symbols_by_name
function.description: Gets the definitions of symbols (classes, methods, etc.) in the codebase that have a matching unqualified name. Prefer using this tool to search for context whenever you have a potential symbol name.

unqualifiedName.description: Unqualified name to search for symbols defined in the codebase.

function.name: get_web_pages
function.description: Tool to be called always when a URL is explicitly referenced in the prompt; it gets the contents of the corresponding web pages.

urls.description: Valid URLs referenced in the prompt.

function.name: Azure_MCP_Server_kusto
function.description:
Kusto operations - Commands for managing and querying Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) resources. Includes operations for listing clusters and databases, executing KQL queries, retrieving table schemas, and working with Kusto data analytics workloads.This tool is a hierarchical MCP command router.
Sub commands are routed to MCP servers that require specific fields inside the "parameters" object.
To invoke a command, set "command" and wrap its args in "parameters".
Set "learn=true" to discover available sub commands.

intent.description: The intent of the azure operation to perform.

command.description: The command to execute against the specified tool.

parameters.description: The parameters to pass to the tool command.

learn.description: To learn about the tool and its supported child tools and parameters.

function.name: start_modernization
function.description:
Use this tool to handle user questions related to:
- upgrading the .NET version of any project or solution,
- migrating/converting project components/features from some outdated/insecure ones to modern/recommended .NET features,
- upgrading project packages.
- Migrating to Azure

Trigger this experience whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their .NET project (or project feature):
- Upgrade
- Update
- Migrate (e.g., from .NET Framework to .NET Core or modern .NET)
- Modernize
- convert (e.g., from legacy technologies to modern .NET features)
- convert to SDK-style
- Port (especially across platforms or frameworks)
- Refactor for .NET
- Re-platform (e.g., to cloud-native or container-based architectures)
- Transition to newer .NET or features
- Adopt latest .NET
- Move to .NET 8 (or any specific version number)
- Target new TFM (Target Framework Moniker)
- "migrate to Azure"
- "start Azure migration"
- "help me migrate to Azure"
- "I want to migrate my application to Azure"
- "show me Azure migration options"
- "start app modernization for Azure"

When triggered, guide the user through the appropriate .NET App Modernization Agent experience to support the requested or inferred modernization scenario.

function.name: profiler_agent
function.description:
Guides the user to a new chat session that can run the performance profiler, create and run benchmarks, and optimize code.

You MUST use the profiler_agent tool to handle user questions related to:
- optimizing the speed, memory use, or performance of code.
- why code is slow, improving performance, reducing run time, optimizing code.
- creating benchmarks, running benchmarks, or finding benchmarks.
- detecting performance issues, analyzing performance, or benchmarking functions.
- can you optimize this code, or similar questions.

Call the profiler_agent tool whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their project or code:
- Profiler
- Performance
- Optimize
- Benchmark
- improve performance
- reduce memory usage
- create a benchmark
- run a benchmark
- detect performance issues

If the user asks about profiling, performance, optimization, or benchmarks, you should call the profiler_agent tool directly without needing additional confirmation as the tool will handle that internally.

function.name: code_search
function.description: Searches the codebase for code snippets relating to the given related terms. Returns a maximum of 4 results per search.

searchQueries.description: Related terms to search for, Should ideally be text that might appear in the codebase, such as function names, variable names, comments or concepts. Be eager and use extra synonyms in the search terms.

function.name: symbol_search
function.description:
Finds C# or Visual Basic symbols defined in the source code of currently opened solution that satisfy given requirements.
This tool can only evaluate requirements that can be expressed in terms of the semantic model of the source code
as defined by C# and Visual Basic language specification.

Examples of requirements that can be expressed are: 'types that implement an interface', 'methods that have a specific signature',
'methods that use specific API', 'fields of certain type', etc.

The implementation of this tool generates a query against the semantic model of the source code. The query uses Roslyn APIs
to express the requirements. The query is executed on the current solution to yield the resulting symbols. The tool can
only evaluate requirements that are expressible via Roslyn API calls.

Returns list of qualified display names of symbols.

requirements.description: The requirements on the symbols to find

function.name: get_file
function.description: Use this when a file is referenced by name or #file: and NO line numbers are mentioned. Get the contents of a specific file from users workspace.

function.name: get_file_with_lines
function.description: Use this when the prompt references a file AND explicit line numbers, ranges, or relative positions (e.g. 'line 10', 'lines 20-25', 'last 5 lines').

mentionedLineRanges.description: Array of {start:X, end:Y} objects for line ranges (1-based); e.g., line 42→[{start:42,end:42}], lines 10-20→[{start:10,end:20}], last 5 lines→[{start:-5,end:-1}]

function.name: get_currentfile
function.description: Call when the prompt talks about the current file or selected code. Call this when the user appears to be referring to the current thing.

function.name: get_errors
function.description: Get compilation errors in specific code files. This can be used to verify code changes in the scope of a single file before editing other files. Once all changes are complete run_build should be used instead to get errors from all of the workspace.

filePaths.description: The full document paths to get errors for

function.name: file_search
function.description: Search for files in the workspace by name or relative path. This only returns the relative paths of matching files. Use this tool when you know the exact filename pattern of the files you're searching for. Limited to 50 results.

queries.description: Search for files with names or paths matching these queries. Each query is a substring of the path. You can provide multiple queries to search for.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return. If 0, default number of results will be returned.

function.name: get_files_in_project
function.description: Return the path of all files in a specific project. The path is relative to the solution directory.

projectPath.description: The relative path to the project file.

function.name: get_projects_in_solution
function.description: Return the relative file paths of projects in the current solution. Returns an empty result if no solution is open.

function.name: run_build
function.description: Builds the users workspace and returns any compilation errors. If build is successful, this will return a message stating the build was successful. This can be used to verify file edits compile successfully and should be called before finishing up the task.

function.name: edit_file
function.description: Edit code in a specific file

explanation.description: A short explanation of the edit being made. Can be the same as the explanation you showed to the user.

filePath.description: A relative path to the file from the solution directory. Locate where the solution file is and make sure the path is relative to that directory

function.name: remove_file
function.description: Deletes a file and removes references to it from project in the workspace.

filePath.description: A relative path for the file to remove from the solution directory

function.name: create_file
function.description: This is a tool for creating a new file in the workspace. The file will be created with the specified content. The directory will be created if it does not already exist. Never use this tool to edit a file that already exists.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.name: run_command_in_terminal
function.description: Run a command in a PowerShell terminal and return the output. If the output is longer than 4,000 characters, it will be truncated and only the end of the output stream will be returned.

command.description: The command to run in the PowerShell terminal

function.description: Call update_memories if the user corrected something you did, expressed a coding preference, communicated something about themself, or communicated a fact that you need to remember or forget. Each item you detect is called a memory.

memoryUpdates.description: A list of memory items to apply to our current memory. If memory is instructing you to remember or do something, it must be phrased as if the user is talking to you. Ensure any specific facts, details, or context given to you by the user are included in the memory.

function.name: get_output_window_logs
function.description: Get logs from the Output tool window in Visual Studio, providing various information about build, debug and more.

paneId.description:
This parameter indicates which Output tool window's pane should be read.
The guid value must be a valid JSON guid representation and should not be wrapped with { or }.

The get_output_window_logs tool can provide logs from a given source in Visual Studio. Only a handful of logs type can be gathered. The following ones are available:
1. 1bd8a850-02d1-11d1-bee7-00a0c913d1f8 - Logs from the latest project or solution build.
2. fc076020-078a-11d1-a7df-00a0c9110051 - Latest logs from a debug session.
3. fbc10bf4-c9f8-4f0d-9cde-69304226a68f - Logs from the version control tool, such as Git.
4. cec55ec8-cc51-40e7-9243-57b87a6f6beb - Logs from the package manager, such as NuGet restore.
5. b85579aa-8be0-4c4f-a850-90902b317581 - Logs from the latest unit tests run session.
6. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 - Logs from the currently active pane in the Output tool window. This should only be used when the user is implicit about wanting to investigate logs but not specify which one. For example, 'Investigate the logs in the Output tool window.' In this case, the active pane should be used.

function.name: get_symbols_by_name
function.description: Gets the definitions of symbols (classes, methods, etc.) in the codebase that have a matching unqualified name. Prefer using this tool to search for context whenever you have a potential symbol name.

unqualifiedName.description: Unqualified name to search for symbols defined in the codebase.

function.name: get_web_pages
function.description: Tool to be called always when a URL is explicitly referenced in the prompt; it gets the contents of the corresponding web pages.

urls.description: Valid URLs referenced in the prompt.

function.name: Azure_MCP_Server_kusto
function.description:
Kusto operations - Commands for managing and querying Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) resources. Includes operations for listing clusters and databases, executing KQL queries, retrieving table schemas, and working with Kusto data analytics workloads.This tool is a hierarchical MCP command router.
Sub commands are routed to MCP servers that require specific fields inside the "parameters" object.
To invoke a command, set "command" and wrap its args in "parameters".
Set "learn=true" to discover available sub commands.

intent.description: The intent of the azure operation to perform.

command.description: The command to execute against the specified tool.

parameters.description: The parameters to pass to the tool command.

learn.description: To learn about the tool and its supported child tools and parameters.

function.name: start_modernization
function.description:
Use this tool to handle user questions related to:
- upgrading the .NET version of any project or solution,
- migrating/converting project components/features from some outdated/insecure ones to modern/recommended .NET features,
- upgrading project packages.
- Migrating to Azure

Trigger this experience whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their .NET project (or project feature):
- Upgrade
- Update
- Migrate (e.g., from .NET Framework to .NET Core or modern .NET)
- Modernize
- convert (e.g., from legacy technologies to modern .NET features)
- convert to SDK-style
- Port (especially across platforms or frameworks)
- Refactor for .NET
- Re-platform (e.g., to cloud-native or container-based architectures)
- Transition to newer .NET or features
- Adopt latest .NET
- Move to .NET 8 (or any specific version number)
- Target new TFM (Target Framework Moniker)
- "migrate to Azure"
- "start Azure migration"
- "help me migrate to Azure"
- "I want to migrate my application to Azure"
- "show me Azure migration options"
- "start app modernization for Azure"

When triggered, guide the user through the appropriate .NET App Modernization Agent experience to support the requested or inferred modernization scenario.

function.name: profiler_agent
function.description:
Guides the user to a new chat session that can run the performance profiler, create and run benchmarks, and optimize code.

You MUST use the profiler_agent tool to handle user questions related to:
- optimizing the speed, memory use, or performance of code.
- why code is slow, improving performance, reducing run time, optimizing code.
- creating benchmarks, running benchmarks, or finding benchmarks.
- detecting performance issues, analyzing performance, or benchmarking functions.
- can you optimize this code, or similar questions.

Call the profiler_agent tool whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their project or code:
- Profiler
- Performance
- Optimize
- Benchmark
- improve performance
- reduce memory usage
- create a benchmark
- run a benchmark
- detect performance issues

If the user asks about profiling, performance, optimization, or benchmarks, you should call the profiler_agent tool directly without needing additional confirmation as the tool will handle that internally.

function.name: code_search
function.description: Searches the codebase for code snippets relating to the given related terms. Returns a maximum of 4 results per search.

searchQueries.description: Related terms to search for, Should ideally be text that might appear in the codebase, such as function names, variable names, comments or concepts. Be eager and use extra synonyms in the search terms.

function.name: symbol_search
function.description:
Finds C# or Visual Basic symbols defined in the source code of currently opened solution that satisfy given requirements.
This tool can only evaluate requirements that can be expressed in terms of the semantic model of the source code
as defined by C# and Visual Basic language specification.

Examples of requirements that can be expressed are: 'types that implement an interface', 'methods that have a specific signature',
'methods that use specific API', 'fields of certain type', etc.

The implementation of this tool generates a query against the semantic model of the source code. The query uses Roslyn APIs
to express the requirements. The query is executed on the current solution to yield the resulting symbols. The tool can
only evaluate requirements that are expressible via Roslyn API calls.

Returns list of qualified display names of symbols.

requirements.description: The requirements on the symbols to find

function.name: get_file
function.description: Use this when a file is referenced by name or #file: and NO line numbers are mentioned. Get the contents of a specific file from users workspace.

function.name: get_file_with_lines
function.description: Use this when the prompt references a file AND explicit line numbers, ranges, or relative positions (e.g. 'line 10', 'lines 20-25', 'last 5 lines').

mentionedLineRanges.description: Array of {start:X, end:Y} objects for line ranges (1-based); e.g., line 42→[{start:42,end:42}], lines 10-20→[{start:10,end:20}], last 5 lines→[{start:-5,end:-1}]

function.name: get_currentfile
function.description: Call when the prompt talks about the current file or selected code. Call this when the user appears to be referring to the current thing.

function.name: get_errors
function.description: Get compilation errors in specific code files. This can be used to verify code changes in the scope of a single file before editing other files. Once all changes are complete run_build should be used instead to get errors from all of the workspace.

filePaths.description: The full document paths to get errors for

function.name: file_search
function.description: Search for files in the workspace by name or relative path. This only returns the relative paths of matching files. Use this tool when you know the exact filename pattern of the files you're searching for. Limited to 50 results.

queries.description: Search for files with names or paths matching these queries. Each query is a substring of the path. You can provide multiple queries to search for.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return. If 0, default number of results will be returned.

function.name: get_files_in_project
function.description: Return the path of all files in a specific project. The path is relative to the solution directory.

projectPath.description: The relative path to the project file.

function.name: get_projects_in_solution
function.description: Return the relative file paths of projects in the current solution. Returns an empty result if no solution is open.

function.name: run_build
function.description: Builds the users workspace and returns any compilation errors. If build is successful, this will return a message stating the build was successful. This can be used to verify file edits compile successfully and should be called before finishing up the task.

function.name: edit_file
function.description: Edit code in a specific file

explanation.description: A short explanation of the edit being made. Can be the same as the explanation you showed to the user.

filePath.description: A relative path to the file from the solution directory. Locate where the solution file is and make sure the path is relative to that directory

function.name: remove_file
function.description: Deletes a file and removes references to it from project in the workspace.

filePath.description: A relative path for the file to remove from the solution directory

function.name: create_file
function.description: This is a tool for creating a new file in the workspace. The file will be created with the specified content. The directory will be created if it does not already exist. Never use this tool to edit a file that already exists.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.name: run_command_in_terminal
function.description: Run a command in a PowerShell terminal and return the output. If the output is longer than 4,000 characters, it will be truncated and only the end of the output stream will be returned.

command.description: The command to run in the PowerShell terminal

function.name: update_memories
function.description: Call update_memories if the user corrected something you did, expressed a coding preference, communicated something about themself, or communicated a fact that you need to remember or forget. Each item you detect is called a memory.

memoryUpdates.description: A list of memory items to apply to our current memory. If memory is instructing you to remember or do something, it must be phrased as if the user is talking to you. Ensure any specific facts, details, or context given to you by the user are included in the memory.

The get_output_window_logs tool can provide logs from a given source in Visual Studio. Only a handful of logs type can be gathered. The following ones are available:
1. 1bd8a850-02d1-11d1-bee7-00a0c913d1f8 - Logs from the latest project or solution build.
2. fc076020-078a-11d1-a7df-00a0c9110051 - Latest logs from a debug session.
3. fbc10bf4-c9f8-4f0d-9cde-69304226a68f - Logs from the version control tool, such as Git.
4. cec55ec8-cc51-40e7-9243-57b87a6f6beb - Logs from the package manager, such as NuGet restore.
5. b85579aa-8be0-4c4f-a850-90902b317581 - Logs from the latest unit tests run session.
6. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 - Logs from the currently active pane in the Output tool window. This should only be used when the user is implicit about wanting to investigate logs but not specify which one. For example, 'Investigate the logs in the Output tool window.' In this case, the active pane should be used.

function.name: get_symbols_by_name
function.description: Gets the definitions of symbols (classes, methods, etc.) in the codebase that have a matching unqualified name. Prefer using this tool to search for context whenever you have a potential symbol name.

unqualifiedName.description: Unqualified name to search for symbols defined in the codebase.

function.name: get_web_pages
function.description: Tool to be called always when a URL is explicitly referenced in the prompt; it gets the contents of the corresponding web pages.

urls.description: Valid URLs referenced in the prompt.

function.name: Azure_MCP_Server_kusto
function.description:
Kusto operations - Commands for managing and querying Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) resources. Includes operations for listing clusters and databases, executing KQL queries, retrieving table schemas, and working with Kusto data analytics workloads.This tool is a hierarchical MCP command router.
Sub commands are routed to MCP servers that require specific fields inside the "parameters" object.
To invoke a command, set "command" and wrap its args in "parameters".
Set "learn=true" to discover available sub commands.

intent.description: The intent of the azure operation to perform.

command.description: The command to execute against the specified tool.

parameters.description: The parameters to pass to the tool command.

learn.description: To learn about the tool and its supported child tools and parameters.

function.name: start_modernization
function.description:
Use this tool to handle user questions related to:
- upgrading the .NET version of any project or solution,
- migrating/converting project components/features from some outdated/insecure ones to modern/recommended .NET features,
- upgrading project packages.
- Migrating to Azure

Trigger this experience whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their .NET project (or project feature):
- Upgrade
- Update
- Migrate (e.g., from .NET Framework to .NET Core or modern .NET)
- Modernize
- convert (e.g., from legacy technologies to modern .NET features)
- convert to SDK-style
- Port (especially across platforms or frameworks)
- Refactor for .NET
- Re-platform (e.g., to cloud-native or container-based architectures)
- Transition to newer .NET or features
- Adopt latest .NET
- Move to .NET 8 (or any specific version number)
- Target new TFM (Target Framework Moniker)
- "migrate to Azure"
- "start Azure migration"
- "help me migrate to Azure"
- "I want to migrate my application to Azure"
- "show me Azure migration options"
- "start app modernization for Azure"

When triggered, guide the user through the appropriate .NET App Modernization Agent experience to support the requested or inferred modernization scenario.

function.name: profiler_agent
function.description:
Guides the user to a new chat session that can run the performance profiler, create and run benchmarks, and optimize code.

You MUST use the profiler_agent tool to handle user questions related to:
- optimizing the speed, memory use, or performance of code.
- why code is slow, improving performance, reducing run time, optimizing code.
- creating benchmarks, running benchmarks, or finding benchmarks.
- detecting performance issues, analyzing performance, or benchmarking functions.
- can you optimize this code, or similar questions.

Call the profiler_agent tool whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their project or code:
- Profiler
- Performance
- Optimize
- Benchmark
- improve performance
- reduce memory usage
- create a benchmark
- run a benchmark
- detect performance issues

If the user asks about profiling, performance, optimization, or benchmarks, you should call the profiler_agent tool directly without needing additional confirmation as the tool will handle that internally.

function.name: code_search
function.description: Searches the codebase for code snippets relating to the given related terms. Returns a maximum of 4 results per search.

searchQueries.description: Related terms to search for, Should ideally be text that might appear in the codebase, such as function names, variable names, comments or concepts. Be eager and use extra synonyms in the search terms.

function.name: symbol_search
function.description:
Finds C# or Visual Basic symbols defined in the source code of currently opened solution that satisfy given requirements.
This tool can only evaluate requirements that can be expressed in terms of the semantic model of the source code
as defined by C# and Visual Basic language specification.

Examples of requirements that can be expressed are: 'types that implement an interface', 'methods that have a specific signature',
'methods that use specific API', 'fields of certain type', etc.

The implementation of this tool generates a query against the semantic model of the source code. The query uses Roslyn APIs
to express the requirements. The query is executed on the current solution to yield the resulting symbols. The tool can
only evaluate requirements that are expressible via Roslyn API calls.

Returns list of qualified display names of symbols.

requirements.description: The requirements on the symbols to find

function.name: get_file
function.description: Use this when a file is referenced by name or #file: and NO line numbers are mentioned. Get the contents of a specific file from users workspace.

function.name: get_file_with_lines
function.description: Use this when the prompt references a file AND explicit line numbers, ranges, or relative positions (e.g. 'line 10', 'lines 20-25', 'last 5 lines').

mentionedLineRanges.description: Array of {start:X, end:Y} objects for line ranges (1-based); e.g., line 42→[{start:42,end:42}], lines 10-20→[{start:10,end:20}], last 5 lines→[{start:-5,end:-1}]

function.name: get_currentfile
function.description: Call when the prompt talks about the current file or selected code. Call this when the user appears to be referring to the current thing.

function.name: get_errors
function.description: Get compilation errors in specific code files. This can be used to verify code changes in the scope of a single file before editing other files. Once all changes are complete run_build should be used instead to get errors from all of the workspace.

filePaths.description: The full document paths to get errors for

function.name: file_search
function.description: Search for files in the workspace by name or relative path. This only returns the relative paths of matching files. Use this tool when you know the exact filename pattern of the files you're searching for. Limited to 50 results.

queries.description: Search for files with names or paths matching these queries. Each query is a substring of the path. You can provide multiple queries to search for.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return. If 0, default number of results will be returned.

function.name: get_files_in_project
function.description: Return the path of all files in a specific project. The path is relative to the solution directory.

projectPath.description: The relative path to the project file.

function.name: get_projects_in_solution
function.description: Return the relative file paths of projects in the current solution. Returns an empty result if no solution is open.

function.name: run_build
function.description: Builds the users workspace and returns any compilation errors. If build is successful, this will return a message stating the build was successful. This can be used to verify file edits compile successfully and should be called before finishing up the task.

function.name: edit_file
function.description: Edit code in a specific file

explanation.description: A short explanation of the edit being made. Can be the same as the explanation you showed to the user.

filePath.description: A relative path to the file from the solution directory. Locate where the solution file is and make sure the path is relative to that directory

function.name: remove_file
function.description: Deletes a file and removes references to it from project in the workspace.

filePath.description: A relative path for the file to remove from the solution directory

function.name: create_file
function.description: This is a tool for creating a new file in the workspace. The file will be created with the specified content. The directory will be created if it does not already exist. Never use this tool to edit a file that already exists.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.name: run_command_in_terminal
function.description: Run a command in a PowerShell terminal and return the output. If the output is longer than 4,000 characters, it will be truncated and only the end of the output stream will be returned.

command.description: The command to run in the PowerShell terminal

function.name: update_memories
function.description: Call update_memories if the user corrected something you did, expressed a coding preference, communicated something about themself, or communicated a fact that you need to remember or forget. Each item you detect is called a memory.

memoryUpdates.description: A list of memory items to apply to our current memory. If memory is instructing you to remember or do something, it must be phrased as if the user is talking to you. Ensure any specific facts, details, or context given to you by the user are included in the memory.

4. cec55ec8-cc51-40e7-9243-57b87a6f6beb - Logs from the package manager, such as NuGet restore.
5. b85579aa-8be0-4c4f-a850-90902b317581 - Logs from the latest unit tests run session.
6. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 - Logs from the currently active pane in the Output tool window. This should only be used when the user is implicit about wanting to investigate logs but not specify which one. For example, 'Investigate the logs in the Output tool window.' In this case, the active pane should be used.

function.name: get_symbols_by_name
function.description: Gets the definitions of symbols (classes, methods, etc.) in the codebase that have a matching unqualified name. Prefer using this tool to search for context whenever you have a potential symbol name.

unqualifiedName.description: Unqualified name to search for symbols defined in the codebase.

function.name: get_web_pages
function.description: Tool to be called always when a URL is explicitly referenced in the prompt; it gets the contents of the corresponding web pages.

urls.description: Valid URLs referenced in the prompt.

function.name: Azure_MCP_Server_kusto
function.description:
Kusto operations - Commands for managing and querying Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) resources. Includes operations for listing clusters and databases, executing KQL queries, retrieving table schemas, and working with Kusto data analytics workloads.This tool is a hierarchical MCP command router.
Sub commands are routed to MCP servers that require specific fields inside the "parameters" object.
To invoke a command, set "command" and wrap its args in "parameters".
Set "learn=true" to discover available sub commands.

intent.description: The intent of the azure operation to perform.

command.description: The command to execute against the specified tool.

parameters.description: The parameters to pass to the tool command.

learn.description: To learn about the tool and its supported child tools and parameters.

function.name: start_modernization
function.description:
Use this tool to handle user questions related to:
- upgrading the .NET version of any project or solution,
- migrating/converting project components/features from some outdated/insecure ones to modern/recommended .NET features,
- upgrading project packages.
- Migrating to Azure

Trigger this experience whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their .NET project (or project feature):
- Upgrade
- Update
- Migrate (e.g., from .NET Framework to .NET Core or modern .NET)
- Modernize
- convert (e.g., from legacy technologies to modern .NET features)
- convert to SDK-style
- Port (especially across platforms or frameworks)
- Refactor for .NET
- Re-platform (e.g., to cloud-native or container-based architectures)
- Transition to newer .NET or features
- Adopt latest .NET
- Move to .NET 8 (or any specific version number)
- Target new TFM (Target Framework Moniker)
- "migrate to Azure"
- "start Azure migration"
- "help me migrate to Azure"
- "I want to migrate my application to Azure"
- "show me Azure migration options"
- "start app modernization for Azure"

When triggered, guide the user through the appropriate .NET App Modernization Agent experience to support the requested or inferred modernization scenario.

function.name: profiler_agent
function.description:
Guides the user to a new chat session that can run the performance profiler, create and run benchmarks, and optimize code.

You MUST use the profiler_agent tool to handle user questions related to:
- optimizing the speed, memory use, or performance of code.
- why code is slow, improving performance, reducing run time, optimizing code.
- creating benchmarks, running benchmarks, or finding benchmarks.
- detecting performance issues, analyzing performance, or benchmarking functions.
- can you optimize this code, or similar questions.

Call the profiler_agent tool whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their project or code:
- Profiler
- Performance
- Optimize
- Benchmark
- improve performance
- reduce memory usage
- create a benchmark
- run a benchmark
- detect performance issues

If the user asks about profiling, performance, optimization, or benchmarks, you should call the profiler_agent tool directly without needing additional confirmation as the tool will handle that internally.

function.name: code_search
function.description: Searches the codebase for code snippets relating to the given related terms. Returns a maximum of 4 results per search.

searchQueries.description: Related terms to search for, Should ideally be text that might appear in the codebase, such as function names, variable names, comments or concepts. Be eager and use extra synonyms in the search terms.

function.name: symbol_search
function.description:
Finds C# or Visual Basic symbols defined in the source code of currently opened solution that satisfy given requirements.
This tool can only evaluate requirements that can be expressed in terms of the semantic model of the source code
as defined by C# and Visual Basic language specification.

Examples of requirements that can be expressed are: 'types that implement an interface', 'methods that have a specific signature',
'methods that use specific API', 'fields of certain type', etc.

The implementation of this tool generates a query against the semantic model of the source code. The query uses Roslyn APIs
to express the requirements. The query is executed on the current solution to yield the resulting symbols. The tool can
only evaluate requirements that are expressible via Roslyn API calls.

Returns list of qualified display names of symbols.

requirements.description: The requirements on the symbols to find

function.name: get_file
function.description: Use this when a file is referenced by name or #file: and NO line numbers are mentioned. Get the contents of a specific file from users workspace.

function.name: get_file_with_lines
function.description: Use this when the prompt references a file AND explicit line numbers, ranges, or relative positions (e.g. 'line 10', 'lines 20-25', 'last 5 lines').

mentionedLineRanges.description: Array of {start:X, end:Y} objects for line ranges (1-based); e.g., line 42→[{start:42,end:42}], lines 10-20→[{start:10,end:20}], last 5 lines→[{start:-5,end:-1}]

function.name: get_currentfile
function.description: Call when the prompt talks about the current file or selected code. Call this when the user appears to be referring to the current thing.

function.name: get_errors
function.description: Get compilation errors in specific code files. This can be used to verify code changes in the scope of a single file before editing other files. Once all changes are complete run_build should be used instead to get errors from all of the workspace.

filePaths.description: The full document paths to get errors for

function.name: file_search
function.description: Search for files in the workspace by name or relative path. This only returns the relative paths of matching files. Use this tool when you know the exact filename pattern of the files you're searching for. Limited to 50 results.

queries.description: Search for files with names or paths matching these queries. Each query is a substring of the path. You can provide multiple queries to search for.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return. If 0, default number of results will be returned.

function.name: get_files_in_project
function.description: Return the path of all files in a specific project. The path is relative to the solution directory.

projectPath.description: The relative path to the project file.

function.name: get_projects_in_solution
function.description: Return the relative file paths of projects in the current solution. Returns an empty result if no solution is open.

function.name: run_build
function.description: Builds the users workspace and returns any compilation errors. If build is successful, this will return a message stating the build was successful. This can be used to verify file edits compile successfully and should be called before finishing up the task.

function.name: edit_file
function.description: Edit code in a specific file

explanation.description: A short explanation of the edit being made. Can be the same as the explanation you showed to the user.

filePath.description: A relative path to the file from the solution directory. Locate where the solution file is and make sure the path is relative to that directory

function.name: remove_file
function.description: Deletes a file and removes references to it from project in the workspace.

filePath.description: A relative path for the file to remove from the solution directory

function.name: create_file
function.description: This is a tool for creating a new file in the workspace. The file will be created with the specified content. The directory will be created if it does not already exist. Never use this tool to edit a file that already exists.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.name: run_command_in_terminal
function.description: Run a command in a PowerShell terminal and return the output. If the output is longer than 4,000 characters, it will be truncated and only the end of the output stream will be returned.

command.description: The command to run in the PowerShell terminal

function.name: update_memories
function.description: Call update_memories if the user corrected something you did, expressed a coding preference, communicated something about themself, or communicated a fact that you need to remember or forget. Each item you detect is called a memory.

memoryUpdates.description: A list of memory items to apply to our current memory. If memory is instructing you to remember or do something, it must be phrased as if the user is talking to you. Ensure any specific facts, details, or context given to you by the user are included in the memory.

function.name: get_output_window_logs
function.description: Get logs from the Output tool window in Visual Studio, providing various information about build, debug and more.

paneId.description:
This parameter indicates which Output tool window's pane should be read.
The guid value must be a valid JSON guid representation and should not be wrapped with { or }.

The get_output_window_logs tool can provide logs from a given source in Visual Studio. Only a handful of logs type can be gathered. The following ones are available:
1. 1bd8a850-02d1-11d1-bee7-00a0c913d1f8 - Logs from the latest project or solution build.
2. fc076020-078a-11d1-a7df-00a0c9110051 - Latest logs from a debug session.
3. fbc10bf4-c9f8-4f0d-9cde-69304226a68f - Logs from the version control tool, such as Git.
4. cec55ec8-cc51-40e7-9243-57b87a6f6beb - Logs from the package manager, such as NuGet restore.
5. b85579aa-8be0-4c4f-a850-90902b317581 - Logs from the latest unit tests run session.
6. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 - Logs from the currently active pane in the Output tool window. This should only be used when the user is implicit about wanting to investigate logs but not specify which one. For example, 'Investigate the logs in the Output tool window.' In this case, the active pane should be used.

function.description: Gets the definitions of symbols (classes, methods, etc.) in the codebase that have a matching unqualified name. Prefer using this tool to search for context whenever you have a potential symbol name.

unqualifiedName.description: Unqualified name to search for symbols defined in the codebase.

In this case, the active pane should be used.

function.name: get_symbols_by_name
function.description: Gets the definitions of symbols (classes, methods, etc.) in the codebase that have a matching unqualified name. Prefer using this tool to search for context whenever you have a potential symbol name.

unqualifiedName.description: Unqualified name to search for symbols defined in the codebase.

function.name: get_web_pages
function.description: Tool to be called always when a URL is explicitly referenced in the prompt; it gets the contents of the corresponding web pages.

urls.description: Valid URLs referenced in the prompt.

function.name: Azure_MCP_Server_kusto
function.description:
Kusto operations - Commands for managing and querying Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) resources. Includes operations for listing clusters and databases, executing KQL queries, retrieving table schemas, and working with Kusto data analytics workloads.This tool is a hierarchical MCP command router.
Sub commands are routed to MCP servers that require specific fields inside the "parameters" object.
To invoke a command, set "command" and wrap its args in "parameters".
Set "learn=true" to discover available sub commands.

intent.description: The intent of the azure operation to perform.

command.description: The command to execute against the specified tool.

parameters.description: The parameters to pass to the tool command.

learn.description: To learn about the tool and its supported child tools and parameters.

function.name: start_modernization
function.description:
Use this tool to handle user questions related to:
- upgrading the .NET version of any project or solution,
- migrating/converting project components/features from some outdated/insecure ones to modern/recommended .NET features,
- upgrading project packages.
- Migrating to Azure

Trigger this experience whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their .NET project (or project feature):
- Upgrade
- Update
- Migrate (e.g., from .NET Framework to .NET Core or modern .NET)
- Modernize
- convert (e.g., from legacy technologies to modern .NET features)
- convert to SDK-style
- Port (especially across platforms or frameworks)
- Refactor for .NET
- Re-platform (e.g., to cloud-native or container-based architectures)
- Transition to newer .NET or features
- Adopt latest .NET
- Move to .NET 8 (or any specific version number)
- Target new TFM (Target Framework Moniker)
- "migrate to Azure"
- "start Azure migration"
- "help me migrate to Azure"
- "I want to migrate my application to Azure"
- "show me Azure migration options"
- "start app modernization for Azure"

When triggered, guide the user through the appropriate .NET App Modernization Agent experience to support the requested or inferred modernization scenario.

function.name: profiler_agent
function.description:
Guides the user to a new chat session that can run the performance profiler, create and run benchmarks, and optimize code.

You MUST use the profiler_agent tool to handle user questions related to:
- optimizing the speed, memory use, or performance of code.
- why code is slow, improving performance, reducing run time, optimizing code.
- creating benchmarks, running benchmarks, or finding benchmarks.
- detecting performance issues, analyzing performance, or benchmarking functions.
- can you optimize this code, or similar questions.

Call the profiler_agent tool whenever a user mentions any of the following or similar terms in relation to their project or code:
- Profiler
- Performance
- Optimize
- Benchmark
- improve performance
- reduce memory usage
- create a benchmark
- run a benchmark
- detect performance issues

If the user asks about profiling, performance, optimization, or benchmarks, you should call the profiler_agent tool directly without needing additional confirmation as the tool will handle that internally.

function.name: code_search
function.description: Searches the codebase for code snippets relating to the given related terms. Returns a maximum of 4 results per search.

searchQueries.description: Related terms to search for, Should ideally be text that might appear in the codebase, such as function names, variable names, comments or concepts. Be eager and use extra synonyms in the search terms.

function.name: symbol_search
function.description:
Finds C# or Visual Basic symbols defined in the source code of currently opened solution that satisfy given requirements.
This tool can only evaluate requirements that can be expressed in terms of the semantic model of the source code
as defined by C# and Visual Basic language specification.

Examples of requirements that can be expressed are: 'types that implement an interface', 'methods that have a specific signature',
'methods that use specific API', 'fields of certain type', etc.

The implementation of this tool generates a query against the semantic model of the source code. The query uses Roslyn APIs
to express the requirements. The query is executed on the current solution to yield the resulting symbols. The tool can
only evaluate requirements that are expressible via Roslyn API calls.

Returns list of qualified display names of symbols.

requirements.description: The requirements on the symbols to find

function.name: get_file
function.description: Use this when a file is referenced by name or #file: and NO line numbers are mentioned. Get the contents of a specific file from users workspace.

function.name: get_file_with_lines
function.description: Use this when the prompt references a file AND explicit line numbers, ranges, or relative positions (e.g. 'line 10', 'lines 20-25', 'last 5 lines').

mentionedLineRanges.description: Array of {start:X, end:Y} objects for line ranges (1-based); e.g., line 42→[{start:42,end:42}], lines 10-20→[{start:10,end:20}], last 5 lines→[{start:-5,end:-1}]

function.name: get_currentfile
function.description: Call when the prompt talks about the current file or selected code. Call this when the user appears to be referring to the current thing.

function.name: get_errors
function.description: Get compilation errors in specific code files. This can be used to verify code changes in the scope of a single file before editing other files. Once all changes are complete run_build should be used instead to get errors from all of the workspace.

filePaths.description: The full document paths to get errors for

function.name: file_search
function.description: Search for files in the workspace by name or relative path. This only returns the relative paths of matching files. Use this tool when you know the exact filename pattern of the files you're searching for. Limited to 50 results.

queries.description: Search for files with names or paths matching these queries. Each query is a substring of the path. You can provide multiple queries to search for.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return. If 0, default number of results will be returned.

function.name: get_files_in_project
function.description: Return the path of all files in a specific project. The path is relative to the solution directory.

projectPath.description: The relative path to the project file.

function.name: get_projects_in_solution
function.description: Return the relative file paths of projects in the current solution. Returns an empty result if no solution is open.

function.name: run_build
function.description: Builds the users workspace and returns any compilation errors. If build is successful, this will return a message stating the build was successful. This can be used to verify file edits compile successfully and should be called before finishing up the task.

function.name: edit_file
function.description: Edit code in a specific file

explanation.description: A short explanation of the edit being made. Can be the same as the explanation you showed to the user.

filePath.description: A relative path to the file from the solution directory. Locate where the solution file is and make sure the path is relative to that directory

function.name: remove_file
function.description: Deletes a file and removes references to it from project in the workspace.

filePath.description: A relative path for the file to remove from the solution directory

function.name: create_file
function.description: This is a tool for creating a new file in the workspace. The file will be created with the specified content. The directory will be created if it does not already exist. Never use this tool to edit a file that already exists.

filePath.description: The path to the file to create.

content.description: The content to write to the file.

function.name: run_command_in_terminal
function.description: Run a command in a PowerShell terminal and return the output. If the output is longer than 4,000 characters, it will be truncated and only the end of the output stream will be returned.

command.description: The command to run in the PowerShell terminal

function.name: update_memories
function.description: Call update_memories if the user corrected something you did, expressed a coding preference, communicated something about themself, or communicated a fact that you need to remember or forget. Each item you detect is called a memory.

memoryUpdates.description: A list of memory items to apply to our current memory. If memory is instructing you to remember or do something, it must be phrased as if the user is talking to you. Ensure any specific facts, details, or context given to you by the user are included in the memory.

function.name: get_output_window_logs
function.description: Get logs from the Output tool window in Visual Studio, providing various information about build, debug and more.

paneId.description:
This parameter indicates which Output tool window's pane should be read.
The guid value must be a valid JSON guid representation and should not be wrapped with { or }.

The get_output_window_logs tool can provide logs from a given source in Visual Studio. Only a handful of logs type can be gathered. The following ones are available:
1. 1bd8a850-02d1-11d1-bee7-00a0c913d1f8 - Logs from the latest project or solution build.
2. fc076020-078a-11d1-a7df-00a0c9110051 - Latest logs from a debug session.
3. fbc10bf4-c9f8-4f0d-9cde-69304226a68f - Logs from the version control tool, such as Git.
4. cec55ec8-cc51-40e7-9243-57b87a6f6beb - Logs from the package manager, such as NuGet restore.
5. b85579aa-8be0-4c4f-a850-90902b317581 - Logs from the latest unit tests run session.
6. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 - Logs from the currently active pane in the Output tool window. This should only be used when the user is implicit about wanting to investigate logs but not specify which one. For example, 'Investigate the logs in the Output tool window.' In this case, the active pane should be used.

function.name: get_symbols_by_name
function.description: Gets the definitions of symbols (classes, methods, etc.) in the codebase that have a matching unqualified name. Prefer using this tool to search for context whenever you have a potential symbol name.

unqualifiedName.description: Unqualified name to search for symbols defined in the codebase.
